intro: Lysimachia fooningensis, commonly known as the Fooning yellow-eyed grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, while the flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. Lysimachia fooningensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
